action.action-desc: Mr. Torres of New York introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To require the Secretary of the Treasury to designate sectorially critical banking institutions, to require a higher level of regulatory supervision of such institutions, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Critical Bank Review Act.

section.header: Designation of sectorially critical banking institutions

subsection.text: The Secretary of the Treasury, in consultation with the banking regulators, shall designate a banking institution as sectorially critical if the banking institution is systemically important to a critical sector of the economy of the United States.

subsection.header: Supervision of sectorially critical banking institutions
subsection.text: The appropriate Federal banking agency shall apply a higher level of regulatory supervision with respect to a sectorially critical banking institution, as determined appropriate by the appropriate Federal banking agency.

paragraph.text: The term appropriate Federal banking agency—

subparagraph.text: has the meaning given that term under section 3 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act; and
means the National Credit Union Administration, in the case of a credit union.
a depository institution (as defined under section 3 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act); and

paragraph.text: The term credit union means a Federal credit union or a State credit union, as such terms are defined, respectively, under section 101 of the Federal Credit Union Act.

The term Federal banking agencies means the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System, the Comptroller of the Currency, the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, and the National Credit Union Administration.
